sentences.english: He became garrulous after a few glasses of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他幾杯酒下肚之後便嘮嘮叨叨說個沒完。

sentences.english: Well, it’s just that your mom was always bugging you about it.
sentences.chinese: 我想大概是你媽媽以前總在在你耳邊嘮叨的關係吧。

sentences.english: It is no use to sermon me.
I've had enough of your tootle.
sentences.chinese: 我已經受夠你的嘮叨了。

sentences.english: You are driving me out of my mind with your nagging.
sentences.chinese: 你嘮叨個沒完，真是煩死我了。

sentences.english: His wife kept on at him to buy her a new coat.
sentences.chinese: 他老婆喋喋不休地嘮叨要他爲她買一件新襖子。

sentences.english: I'm tired of your perpetual nag ging .
sentences.chinese: 我對你無休止的嘮叨厭煩了。

sentences.english: Joy kept yacking (on) about the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊嘮嘮叨叨地聊著婚禮的事。

sentences.english: She droned away for hours about her pet subjects.
sentences.chinese: 她對她所喜歡的話題一連嘮叨了幾個小時。

sentences.english: Her family nagged her continually because of her association with Negroes.
sentences.chinese: 因她跟黑人有交往，她的家人對她嘮叨個不停。

sentences.english: She was prating of her responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 她嘮嘮叨叨地傻談責任。

sentences.english: Stop gabbing! I’m trying to study.
The wretched girl was always a chatterbox.
sentences.chinese: 從前，這個可憐的女孩總是很嘮叨。

sentences.english: This lawyer verbalizes and is rather tedious.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師嘮嘮叨叨，單調乏味。

sentences.english: The man cannot be borne or ultimate inexorable woman chatters perpetually.
sentences.chinese: 男人不能忍受或者根本聽不進女人沒完沒了的嘮叨。

definition: to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms
